semantic_identifier: 117: feat: Compliance checklist: derive required deployment items from customer segment/region/regulatory context

sections.text:
## Description

### What
- Auto-computes a “Required for deployment” subset of the existing Deployment Readiness compliance checklist based on impacted customer/account context (CRM attributes + Customer_Analyzer outputs).
- Highlights missing/unchecked required items to surface compliance blockers earlier, without changing the current checklist interaction model.

### How
- Adds a lightweight rules engine (`ComplianceRequirementDeriver`) that maps normalized customer context to required checklist items (e.g., regulated => Security Review, EU region => DPA, specific segments => retention constraints).
- Introduces a context aggregation layer (`ImpactedCustomerContextResolver`) that:
  - collects linked impacted customers from the issue/theme,
  - fetches CRM account fields (region, regulated flags, etc.),
  - fetches Customer_Analyzer fields (segment/ICP),
  - normalizes/merges into a single derived context with deterministic precedence.
- Computes the union of required items across all impacted customers and attaches it to the checklist payload as `derivedRequiredItemIds` + `missingRequiredItemIds`.
- UI updates are additive only: the checklist renders required badges and gap highlighting using the new fields; existing item selection/checkbox workflow remains unchanged.

### Notes
- Safe-by-default behavior: if customer context is unavailable, no additional requirements are inferred.
- Includes unit tests for rule evaluation and multi-customer union behavior; adds a small integration test covering the end-to-end derivation payload.

### User impact
- When an issue/theme has impacted customers linked, the checklist will show which items are required for deployment and which required items are still incomplete.

## How Has This Been Tested?
